pros: The products are really intuitive. People have the zeal to work and innovate.
cons: Promotions are a rare and provided in only select teams. Management has become quite inefficient.

pros: Good work-life, good management within org, well-defined path for promotion/career growth
cons: Slow pace of development, zero perks, generally a bit depressing

pros:
Very good compensation
A lot of clever people to learn from
cons:
If you join the wrong part of the business you can destroy your career
Management does not care about people

summary: Good work life balance. No benefits. In general its okay
pros:
Work like balance
Good pay
Learned a lot
Good systems
cons:
Bad culture
Don't care about employees
No benefits
Extremely miserly

summary: Good pay if you are. Good performer, org direction is uncertain
pros: You get good pay as long as you have a good rating
cons: Constant stack ranking, no compensation adjustment for under performers here

pros: Good career progress, best cloud company. People know what they are doing
cons: Too frugal in comp and not great work life balance

pros: Great Comp and Benefits. Good career progression if you are patient and play the game
cons: Constantly changing initiatives can be exhausting. Poor middle managers for the most part (even the CEO thinks there is too much bureaucracy in the middle of the pack for leadership). Can be long hours and high pressure. PIP culture

pros: interesting work and smart coworkers. And Good environment for collaboration
cons: no benefit such as lunch and gym. Too many layers in the reporting chain

pros: Nothing is good about this sweatshop. Do not work here
cons: The entore company is a con, specially AWS AI/ML org

pros: If you like money, Amazon can only be beat by a few other companies.
cons: If you like work life balance and mentorship, Amazon can only lose to a few other companies.
reasonResign: Mentorship and leadership among management left a lot to be desired. Work life balance was not the best.

pros: Pay, benefits, career growth, opportunities, learning and  peers are really good.
cons:
URA and "go up or go out" culture are bad.
Forced 5 day RTO is sad.

summary: Everything seems about what you find online
pros:
Money - You get paid more than well
Location
Recognition
cons:
WLB - Will have to put in a lot of hours
Oncall

summary: Great place to learn, but worst in terms of WLB
pros: You'll learn a great deal and work with the greatest minds
cons: Toxic work culture. Horrible work-life balance. Not so great management

summary: Your experience may vary depending on your team
pros: Plenty of career growth opportunities if you’re proactive, the path is there if you play it right. Total comp is competitive.
cons: Promotions can be a grind. When deadlines hit, WLB can get rough. Leadership principles are everywhere — take that how you will. Some teams feel collaborative, others more transactional.

pros: Salary is high but also very dependent on stock performance
cons: Five days a week in office which is pretty well enforced

pros: Good pay if you are getting yoy TT rating. Wlb is very team dependent
cons: The promotion timelines have increased and pay hikes are not enough. On top of that, the wlb is poor with many engineers being forced to work on weekends

summary: Used to be a great place to work but we became a consultancy
pros:
Good work life balance IF you manage to play it smart
For the first 4 years you will be paid well
cons:
Culture is exactly what you would expect from a big consulting firm with a lot of politics
No way to grow and L6/7 is considered an impossible plateau to move past
Managers care only about numbers
Leadership cares only about stock price

summary: Amazon lives up to its name. Join if you want to break into faang but expect long hours, pip, and stagnant comp.
pros: Faang name, relatively high comp compared to non faang companies.
cons: Bad culture, bad leadership. Constant fear of layoffs and pip.

pros: Compensation is one of the best in India. Plenty of WLB
cons: Horrible leadership. No clarity on how to make career progress

pros: None that I can think of. Make sure you stay away
cons: Toxic managers and pip/pivot culture, even if you are a high performer

pros: Amazon has decent opportunities for career growth if you are willing
cons: The culture and enthusiasm after bezos is pretty poor, ship without a captain

pros: Ok pay, stock refresh (but overestimated value), smart coworkers and friendly
cons: 5 day rto, inflated stock price, long hours, pip culture

pros: aws sets industry standards, and is very heavily (and well) used within amazon. starting your career here gives you an outstanding environment to learn system design principles, build and scale products, and develop a strong resume (with quite competitive pay)
cons: amazon is very top-down, and (obviously this is team dependent) a lot of self advocacy is needed to position yourself on interesting projects with good learning opportunities. nothing is handed to you.

pros:
I think the good parts are very team dependent, but for me:
- Smart people
- Manageable workload and expectations
- Interesting projects
- Good growth opportunities
cons:
- Corporate bureaucracy 
- Project managers can be hit or miss and make your job harder
- Oncall

summary: Pay is better but projects are bad
pros: Pay and visa  are good and taken care off. Company gives you full relocation
cons: Innovation is lacking, they want to promote unwanted project, without building and deploying exsisting projects

summary: Good team but too much reorg
pros:
Profesional team, talented teammates and nice Seniors Devs.
Team building, nice offices.
cons:
Reord three times within 1 year.
Politics cut product.
RTO 5 days.

pros: Great work life balance, great internal resources to learn, and competent management teams
cons: Upward mobility is very limited and cannot be promoted even performing at next level

summary: Great place to learn massive scale
pros:
It’s great place if you want to learn how to
Scale massive systems.
cons: Can be very stressful and not much work life balance. Some orgs are better than others.

pros: Pay..? If that can even be considered here. I wouldn't touch it with a 10 ft pole
cons: Everything! It's become a day 2 company with all the recent changes

pros: Pay, learns a lot from the wise guys, good resume item
cons: Management is horrible, the whole reorg thing, benefit is so so, no free food
